Jenny, Samantha, and Mark hiked along the trail by the waterfall. The smell of warm pine and brief-blooming wildflowers wafted through the woods on the last warm day of summer. Birds chirped delighted chatter, lit by the rays of afternoon sun that filtered through the forest canopy above.

As they approached the water, Mark gave a grin and tore off his shirt. He ran down the trail to the edge of the water, just next to the falls. Jenny and Samantha watched as Mark tore off his shoes and socks, then launched himself into the churning water. He disappeared, then his head bobbed up, still showing his goofy grin.

Jenny and Samantha looked at one another and shrugged. They ran to the edge of the water, slipped off their shoes and jumped in as well. The water's glacier-fed coolness numbed the Autumn heat.

Mark gave Jenny a splash. Then, Samantha. The girls shrieked and giggled before returning fire. The battle became fierce, but Mark finally succumbed, the sloshes and splatters of two beating one.

As they all laughed in enjoyment of their effervescent game, Samantha looked toward the roar of the water and noticed something behind its white veil. Something colorful. She swam toward the falls as the others moved toward shore to lounge at the water's edge and have lunch.

Samantha passed under the sheet of water, its hammering weight pounding on shoulders and back like an overenthusiastic masseuse.

There were three orbs that glowed, like spherical house lamps with holiday LED bulbs inside. One was blue, one was green, and one was yellow.

She reached out and touched the green one, her slender finger pressing it's iridescent surface. She could feel a faint hum inside, the hum grew stronger. She attempted to remove her finger, but she couldn't! It was glued to the orb. The buzzing intensified, until it seemed to vibrate every cell of her entire body, as if she were standing in front of a bank of speakers at a summer rock concert.

Just when the feeling was becoming unbearable, the orb disappeared. Samantha felt something enter her mind. An idea that wasn't her own. The sensation was strange. She knew what she needed to do somehow. She needed to choose. She focused her mind on what she wanted to look like, what she always imagined herself in her wildest fantasies.

A strange tingling spread through her body, and she shuddered. What was going on now?

Free from the hold of the green orb, she backed out through the waterfall again and headed to shore.

Jenny and Mark turned to her as she emerged from the water's white, thundering veil.

The face they saw was transforming, eyebrows thinning and rising, eyes growing large and luminous, cheekbones shifting to elegant prominence. Her lips plumped.

Her body began to rise out of the water as she moved toward the others. Her breasts swelled to luscious fullness under her tank, dripping water from under voluptuous curves. Her wet top was plastered against developing abs, their vertical ridges forming lines in the fabric.

Her hips grew wider, more dynamic, exaggerating her feminine gait as she walked in the water. Each step came on longer legs, their nubile shapes growing sleeker, sexier, water flowed down their toned, tanned length.

Jenny watched her friends' eyes widen in shock as they started at her body. She looked down to see full breasts obscuring her view in a way they never had before. Her head snapped back up, then looked down again to examine the rest of her changes.

Her body was the one she had imagined, full and firm and all kinds of sexy. Surprise gave way to happiness as joy erupted from her...

"I must be dreaming," Mark's voice exploded with a gasp. The light green sheen caressing his friend's body pulsed a final moment before melting into Samantha's skin.

"Can I touch?" Jenny grew wide-eyed at the transformation standing before her. "Is it real? How?"

"That did it," Samantha's supple turn showed off every curve of a perfect athlete's well-toned healthy body. Her voice had lost the faint leftover cough of the last few days.

Mark followed her long tapering finger pointed at the waterfall. "The Garden of Youth?" He went into a swimmer's dive, slim body sinking without a splash. A moment later he floated on his back near the bubbling waves of the waterfall. He paddled in slow motion waiting for something to happen.

Jenny moved close enough to Samantha to grasp her head between both hands and stare into her eyes. Strange flecks of emerald green danced and flickered where once dull gray had been. "What got into you? Some magic pill from the college research lab you've been working at?"

Samantha shook her luxuriant length of silky hair, "No. It was the strangest thing. There was a green ball shaped thing behind the waterfall. It called to me and this happened when I reached up and grasped it. I think it is inside of me now. Something is. I don't feel like I am living in my own body."

The two girls hugged, eyes never leaving each other. "At least your personality is the same. It didn't take you over body, mind, and soul." Jenny said.

"Hey. It's not working. What did you do?" Mark pulled himself up out of the water. "We can make ourselves rich. Show me."

"Stop being stupid." Samantha didn't want to be turned into a freak show. One push and Mark found himself failing, unbalanced with arms out wide, falling backward into the pool.

"You are beautiful," Jenny sighed. "I've never seen anyone so attractive. The sound of your voice, every movement. I can't believe the change happened so fast."

Samantha stood like a living Greek goddess statue, "Look. There's more orbs, different colored ones, where the first one was. We'll get to the bottom of this yet."

She dove, swimming like a fish streaking toward the waterfall mist. Jenny hesitated, watched Mark summersault into a diver's turn and churn up waves following after his friend.

"We don't know what we are doing. We should tell someone," Jennifer couldn't leave her friends to their fate without joining them. She bit her lip, steeled up her shoulders and plunged feet first sinking below the water to swim towards Samantha and Mark.

A soft rainbow haze blossomed over the mist when Jenny rose up to greet them. "Samantha? You touched the green one, right?" Mark leaned on her shoulder to reach up where one floated in space behind the waterfall.

A look of excruciating pain on Mark's face made Samantha wince as she looked on. "What did she do to you? Mark? Are you, O.K.?"

"Sorry." Jenny let go like she'd grabbed someone's freshly mangled flesh from a meat grinder. The purple and red bruise pulsing lively on Mark's hand was shocking. "I don't know what happened. Yes, I do. It was that."

It was Mark who was the first to overcome the lump in his throat and managed to squeak out the question. “Wha… I mean who…” he coughed and then added. “What and who are you?”

The figure laughed and flipped backward, doing a backward summersault as he hovered in the air and then drifted down to eye line with Mark and smiled broadly in his face. The figure then extended a six-fingered hand and clasped Mark’s rather forcibly.

“Gergovitchkanvrolar Septinitanleoti.”

Mark eyes went wide as it felt like whoever this figure was, he had just placed his hand in a vice, and then smashed it. The pain was so intense he almost blacked out instantly, as a mere handshake from this person had shattered what had to be every bone in his hand. Gergovitchkanvrolar though seemed to get that he had done something wrong, as his eyes went wide and he looked down at the hand, and then said. “Oh. My bad.” And around his hand a bright white light emerged and all of a sudden Mark felt the pain leave him, and he stumbled back.

The first-year college student hit the dirt with a thud and stared at his now healed hand in disbelief. Samantha was quick to demand. “What did you do,” as the strange figure floated back up into the air and held up his hands in defence.

“Sorry, sorry. My apologies. I am not used to dealing with unevolved… no that’s not right. Sorry unenhanced lifeforms.” He forced another fanged smile and turned to Mark and coughed. “Really I am sorry. Please can we start over I feel I am making a real cat’s ear of this introduction.” He then floated down next to Jenny faster then anyone could spot and whispered to her. “Is cats ear the right term?”

Jenny jumped back several meters though, and joined Mark on the dirt floor.

“Okay stop this,” Samantha demanded, pointing a finger at the floating figure who now had returned to a gentle hovering height just out of arms reach. “Who are you Gergovelch, or whatever your name is!”

The figure laughed and raised a hand as if it would calm the now superhuman woman. “Yes, yes. I will explain. Though for simplicities sake call me Greg, and I am an extraterrestrial lifeform.”

The trio were once more disarmed by this almost casual revelation and were left a full minute processing the information before Jenny spoke up.

“You mean like E.T… or Yoda.”

Greg nodded. “Yoda, yes… although I don’t know what ET is. Should I watch, read or eat it?” He leaned in now, after counting off those three options on his six-fingered hand before flashing what could only be called a dashing smile.

“Umm, it is a movie.” Mark began.

“Oh, a movie. What fun. Then yes, I will watch it tonight.” He then laughed seeing Jenny and mark’s blank expressions of confusion and Samantha’s expression which was a mix of pissed and concern for her friends. Greg on seeing this sighed and again floated down, though this time landed on the ground, his powerful legs and imposing height being all the clearer now they had some reference next to Samantha, who he dwarfed. “Look please calm down. I don’t mean you harm. I mean look at what I have done for you?”

Samantha now perfectly formed eyebrows raised in an expression of ‘seriously.’

“Wait, you gave her the orbs?” Jenny asked in surprise.”

Greg shrugged, and pointed back to the waterfall. “Well left there under that water formation. But yes, you found one of my gifts.”

“Gifts?” Samantha said now feeling a new series of questions enter her mind, as she now looked up at what was clearly an Alien humanoid, but one she couldn’t help find somewhat handsome.

“Of course. I am what you call a… tourist. I teleport around the galaxy observing unevolved lifeforms and well.”

“Make them superheroes.” Mark said in excitement.

Greg laughed again. “Oh, celestials no. I fuck with them.”

That statement earned another series of blank looks from the trio, which caused Greg’s laughter to taper off into a nervous chuckle: followed by a cough. “Well within reason. I am not a spiteful individual. Nor do I enjoy genocide. No, I am a… agent of chaos.”

Samantha stared at him in shock. “How is that any better.”

“No, no.” Greg said shaking his head. “I am sorry, I am so used to instantaneous mental communication my verbal skills are somewhat rusty, so things get lost in translation. I am…” he again paused to think. “I am that droplet falling in a flat plane of water. The flat plane is boring, uninspired, simple. The droplet adds movement, spice and well momentum.”

Mark then nodded. “I get it. You’re an agent of change.”

Greg clapped his hand and pointed two fingers on each hand at mark. “And progress my good man. Yes, change and progress. You see I am from a megastructure nearer the core of the universe, where life evolved around a two billion years before yours did. We long ago achieved biological perfection, ecological sustainability and technological mastery. As such the only new thing we really can do is bring new races into the fold, and well…” he pointed to Mark’s hand and smiled. “You’re a bit behind in the evolution department. So, we ‘tourists’ tour the cosmos spreading genetic advancement to all of the… less evolved races and bring you up to an equal playing field.”

“And the orbs.” Samantha asked.

“Our little way of having fun.” Greg admitted with a shrug. “You see its not so much for us to dump ultimate power on you, you need to use it responsibly first. Get it bit by bit and learn to use it. So, we push people to seek out the power and in doing so learn about themselves and their new abilities.”

“So, wait, there are more orbs?” Jessica cried.

To which Greg smiled. “As you three were the first to stumble on one of my caches. I’ll give you a hint. Up the mountain is a cave. If you can get to it the powers inside are yours.”

“And if we don’t get it?” Mark asked.

“Well someone one day will. I mean I don’t plan on going back to get them.” He snorted. “Still the important part of this is for you to learn and have fun. Now, what do you say?”

Having received a hint from Greg, Mark, Jenny and Samantha now headed up the gradually increasing slope Mount Nibs: following the vague direction of a being who had really only described himself as an interplanetary prankster. It was a hard path, but after seeing what those orbs had done for Samantha, how could they not press on.

Yet out of all of them, Jenny could not help but bring her doubts forward.

“So, do you think he is telling the truth?”

Nobody dared to slow their pace up the rocky trail, but both Mark and Samantha, who was setting an incredible stride on her model-like legs, looked back at her in a way which could only help but convey surprise. Mark shrugged and pointed at Samantha, as if that would answer the question.

“Well they are his orbs and I mean… look at what they did for Samantha.”

The now neon green amazon giggled and spun around and wiggled her now wide childbearing hips with an almost delighted grin on her face. Indeed, ever since the transformation she had not stopped smiling.

Like before, Jenny felt her mind fog over, as with every subtle move she found herself more and more attracted to her best friend. Mark too was having a hard time concentrating, but for Jenny this was so surreal: she wasn’t into girls… Her mind trailed off again, causing Samantha to walk up to her and with a gentle prod of her finger snapped close Jenny’s mouth.

“Careful Jenny. You’ll catch flies.”

All at once reality came crashing back to Jenny and she shook her head, blushed, and then redoubled her pace up the mountain.

“All I am saying, can we trust him?”

Three hours later the trio had spent the better part of the afternoon exploring the highest peaks of Mt. Nibs. It wasn’t an impossible-to-climb mountain, more of an excessive hike. Yet after only an hour and a half both Mark and Jenny were pooped. They were now stopping every half hour, and in desperation both of the unpowered individuals had surrendered and were now allowing Samantha to carry them.

By now the shadows were getting long, as the sun began to set behind the mountain. Mark checked his phone and saw not only was his battery low but it was getting close to six. He absently wondered as he bobbed in Samantha’s strong arms if they would ever find the cave.

He let a hand cup her arm and felt the hard steel like wires that were her muscles beneath the skin and felt himself not only marvel at her strength but also found himself getting incredibly turned on.

He wanted this. Strength like hers, to be worthy of her, or someone like her.

His eyes then turned to Jenny who Samantha was carrying under arm, and who was now lightly dozing after tuckered herself out with her fears of Greg. He smiled at her at first, but then paused as he began to imagine… how would she change.

He felt himself get hard at the thought, and let out a nervous chuckle.

Samantha caught this and shot him a glance, and smirked. “Enjoying the ride, are we?”

Mark blushed and shifted his pants. “Sorry, you’re just so…”

“Oh, I know,” Samantha grinned. “But I am wondering how much sexier I can be. Tell me. Does that turn you on?”

With her come hither look, Mark froze and began to feel his own mind go blank. She was perfect, too perfect. Her smouldering dark brown eyes, long lashes, the way her green hair fell about her face in great tassels and how her lips just moved. He began to look around for a distraction when he cried out.

“Oh, hey, is that the cave?”

And sure enough, there was a cave. It was buried into the side of a cliff, where rainwater had once pooled and slowly carved out a large gorge through the bare chalk. It went far enough down to become dark towards the back, but sure enough, a faint glow could be seen emanating from within, the colours enrapturing Samantha and Mark.

Power was within reach and, whatever was within the save called to them.

Samantha set Mark and Jenny down, the tired girl letting out a yawn as she and Mark crossed the threshold of the cave, ignoring the animal bones littered around the entrance. Still, as they walked, almost hypnotised a crack broke whatever spell was over them and Samantha looked down and saw in her haste she had severed what had likely been a bone to some deer.

Before she and Mark could wonder why the bone was here a growl from within the save could be heard, and there, walking into the light, came a great, black bear.

1211113.content:
This chapter was contributed by The-PBG  . I was asked to post on their behalf :)

“Oh shit, oh shit, oh shit!”

Mark was the first out of the cave, snatching Jenny by the hand and dragging her till she woke up in a bout of confusion.

“Mark what is…!”

The unearthly roar from within the cave shook whatever sleep had overtaken Jenny and she was soon on her feet running with her friend, fleeing towards the treeline before even daring to turn to look at the cave. Yet as soon they were at safe distance and the two of them glanced back to the rocky hole that was the cave entrance, they heard a scream and soon saw Samantha come flying out of it.

Their superpowered friend slammed into the ground not far from them, her momentum cutting another shallow trench in the earth as she landed. With whatever was left of her jacket and top falling away. She now rose to her feet, bare-chested, exposing her unearthly beauty to the world. Jenny had a chance to call out “Samantha your top,” but the neon green amazon did not hear. Instead, she stared back at the cave knowing that bear would soon come for her.

It didn’t long for her theory to be proved correct as the bear left the cave…

By jumping 30 feet into the air.

All three of the college students tracked its ascent in disbelief as the creature somehow had leapt as high as Samantha had when she had first used her powers. It moved in an unusual arc, its arms and legs flailing, yet was very clearly coming straight for them: its clawed paws outstretched. And then it dawned on Samantha.

It had somehow used one of the orbs.

She had a split second to notice her friends behind her, and to register the descending bear when she made up her mind and jumped.

Coils of superpowered muscle leapt into action as her powerful legs barely needed to bend, as with a simple kick, she too found herself propelled skyward towards the beast. The now half-naked goddess moved like a bullet, one of her arms outstretched towards the bear and managed to connect a solid gut punch to the beast. The howl of the giant furred mass of superpowers was so loud it shook the air and defended not only her but Mark and Jenny who were now a good quarter of a mile below. Yet her own superpowered blow had stunned it, and Samantha took her opportunity to grip the black fur and while still in air swung it over her head and threw it towards the other side of the mountain bellow.

The bear hit with the force of a small explosion, creating a huge crater in cliffside. One which Samantha descended upon like an angel from on high as she fell, more gracefully than last time, flipping herself over as to allow her legs to collide with the beast, feet first.

A second explosion now erupted from the mountainside, and for those in town, several miles away, it looked to be an avalanche had happened on the side of Mount Nibs.

For Samantha though it just felt as though she had missed a step on a staircase. An inconvenient jolt, but otherwise she was fine.

The bear through…

Whichever of the orbs had granted her this durability sure as hell hadn’t affected the bear. It was standing up, but it was bleeding heavily from numerous cuts and bruises; one of its arms was bent in a weird way; and Samantha was sure part of its skull was showing. Still now in a frenzy, it roared as soon as it got a clear look at her. It bought its claws up to swipe at the neon green hair that was billowing around Samantha at this point. Yet this time Samantha was prepared and she braced for the hit and…

Nothing. On hitting Samantha, the claws had only gently indented her skin, as a finger would if you pressed down hard enough. Yet there was no mark of scratch. Indeed, it seemed the momentum and force of blow had just been absorbed by the now superpowered college student, who looked at the bear's arm and managed a laugh. She laughed and laughed and the bear just stood there unsure what to do as this tiny human had just taken all it had to give and more and was now… laughing?

Samantha bought her hand up. She revealed in the feeling of power she now had and rested a hand on the bear's outstretched limb and smiled.

“My turn.”

And with that, she seized the forearm of the creature, and with the deftest touch, the bones in the limb shattered.

The bear roared and fell onto its back, its mangled arm trying to clasp its other mangled arm: all while bleeding damaged and injured. Samantha watched for a moment, revealing in her strength. She had defeated a bear with her ‘bear hands’ and even while this bear was likely as strong as her. She felt like she could do anything!

That was until the beast began to whimper. A low painful growl, filled with fear and sorrow. And it then dawned on Samantha that they had kind of walked into this bears home, barged in without a second look and beaten it to a pulp. It had likely been scared, frightened and now it was so injured it would surely die.

Samantha bit her lip, as the super-powered amazon wondered what to do.

10 minutes later

“Why did you bring that thing back here!” Jenny screamed as Samantha lowered the battered body of the one-tonne bear to the floor as if it was a shopping bag.

“Jenny, we invaded its home. Of course, it was going to attack us.” Samantha explained as she looked at the now defeated king of the forest, whining in pain. The neon green victor then bent down and gently patted the defeated creature on the snout. The bear seeing the kindness and likely fearing Samantha after such an awesome arse-kicking gently licked her hand in a sign of submission. Samantha smiled, sensing the respect from the creature now. “Plus, you know I love animals Jenny. Maybe with these new powers, there is something we can do for it.”

Jenny scowled and kept a good distance back from the black bear which pinned under its breath. It was in a lot of pain, and from that mere sound Jenny’s heart softened and she looked away. “Yeah well… it better be grateful.”

“Hey, guys! I found them.”

Hearing Mark’s voice the two girls looked towards the cave and then at each other. Jenny had to hold up her hand to conceal Samantha’s lower half to keep her head on straight, but both of them shared an excited grin.

Rushing to the back of the cave both girls saw the glow before they got there, but when they did their eyes went wide. There at the back of the cave were no less than eight orbs.

2 green orbs, 1 blue orb, a grey orb, a white orb 2 yellow orbs and a black orb.

With the orbs lying before her Samantha felt her mouth become very dry. When she had first found the orbs, it had been a shock. Then when she had gone back to them it had been her curiosity. But now it was an ever-burning desire. What would happen if she was to touch another green orb or blue orb? What kind of powers would she develop, what would she look like?

Looking down she gazed at her bare chest, her nips turning hard in the open air, there gelatine firmness bouncing ever so slightly as gravity tried to exert some effort on them, only for her super strength to say no. She clutched at her neon green hair, and ran her fingers through it, marveling at its silken texture, its lustre and shine. Her mind fogged up with the possibilities, and a dumb smile crept across her lips.

It was then that a noise shook her back to reality. The pained moans of the bear behind her, and she bit her lip.

Yes, she was powerful, but she had to be responsible with that power. She had to undo the wrong she had performed as well as…

She let out a dumb chuckle as her eyes turned towards the green orbs, with a thousand possibilities running through her head.

“Umm Samantha,” Jenny voice caught her off guard, and she turned to see both Mark and Jenny looking at the floor, almost embarrassed to be near her. “First off could you put some clothes on.”

A question to which Samantha smirked and replied. “No.” Jenny looked up in protest, and Samantha merely giggled. Why should she? She was the hottest this thing on earth and sure she wanted to see what this body looked like in that dress she had seen in that boutique window: but right now, she wanted to reveal in this power. A power which could cower people with but a look.

Jenny’s response to this was a protesting gasp, as whatever line she had prepared melted in the face of Samantha, and Jenny’s eyes became fixed on Samantha’s perfect teats, her head now nodding in motion with them.

“O-okay.” Jenny gulped and Mark looked up and looked Samantha dead in the eye… at first. Both of them paused as Jenny then added. “S-second thing Samantha. Which orbs should we take?”

Samantha smirked again. The fact that her friends were asking for her suggestion, filled her with more confidence. She was the expert here, the saviour, the knowledgeable individual. It was nice to be on the other end from Mark the know it all.

“Well,” she said stepping up to the orbs and looking down at glowing spheres. “Not these ones.”

Her hands came to rest on a white and green sphere, as Mark and Jenny called out in protest.

“Sam no!”

Only for Sam to laugh as that same buzzing she had felt before overtook her.

The energy from the orbs flowed up her arms and into her body, the Green energy snaking along her left arm and white aura moving along her right. As it did Samantha threw back her head and gasped. This was amazing! Beyond amazing! And as Samantha closed her eyes she felt those same thoughts that were not her own, enter her mind.

What body do you desire?

What changes shall be made?

How beautiful do you want to be?

Samantha let these questions wash over her as she saw her form right now. An amazon of green hair, perfect chest and model-like proportions. She was everything she wanted to be.

And yet now she wanted more.

With her mind she sculpted her form. Her chest grew larger, larger then any girl could support on her own, yet they remained perfect spheres with only enough sag to seem natural. Her heart shape rear firmed and tightened. Her more muscular traits softened without losing an ounce of strength, yet her tight eight pack grew more pronounced to that of a ten.

Green hair now billowed around her, growing first down her back, then past her arse and then to her heels. It draped her like a cloak, strands disappearing into cleavage which now naturally formed.

Her face changed still. Her blue eyes turned green to match that of her hair, her eyebrows thinned and with the slightest change her already astonishing face became even more heavenly.

And then with a final gasp Samantha felt the last of the energy flow into her and she let go, and let out a gasp.

And from that gasp she heard a new voice, a sultrier voice, one which spoke with a deep feminine confidence. One which with the right choice of words could cream and man with the sheer subtlety of her tones.

She was going to enjoy this.

Yet from behind she heard the same pained whining of the bear, and then stared down at her hand. Within her palm a white glow emanated and she let herself smirk.

“Come here little one. Let me heal you.”
